title: Oakland man shot dead on train sparking fears of terror attack

text:
Police are searching for a man who fatally shot a passenger on a packed train and then fled when it stopped at the West Oakland station.
The suspect fled the Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) train as some passengers frantically tried to save the shooting victim Saturday night.
Some passengers ran out of the train and dived on to the ground, fearing it was a terror attack.
Police are searching for a man who fatally shot a passenger on a packed train and then fled when it stopped at the West Oakland station (file photo)
Brad Chapin, a psychology student from San Francisco, told the Oakland Tribune he was wearing earbuds and watching a video on his phone when heard shots being fired.
'Everyone just got down on the ground. People were screaming. It was chaos,' Chapin said. 'We didn't know if there were terrorists there or what.'
He said about half of the passengers ran out of the train: 'So many people thought they were going to die. It was terrifying.'
BART spokesman Jim Allison confirmed Sunday that the shooting was an isolated incident and not part of a terrorist attack.
Some passengers ran out of the train and dived on to the ground, fearing it was a terror attack. (file picture)
The suspect fled the Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) train as some passengers frantically tried to save the shooting victim Saturday night. (file picture)
BART police Lt. Aaron Ledford confirmed that the victim, who has not been named, was in possession of 'some sort of knife.'
Police detained a man who fit the description of the suspect shortly after the incident, but later released him after determining he was not involved, Ledford said.
Witnesses described how they saw a man get on the train several stops before the attack.
